                                                                    <div class="message-userContent lbContainer js-lbContainer "
                                                                        data-lb-id="post-88515405"
                                                                        data-lb-caption-desc="DesertChocolate &middot; Nov 22, 2022 at 7:53 AM">








                                                                        <article class="message-body js-selectToQuote">














                                                                            <div class="bbWrapper">Reincarnation is a
                                                                                bitch. Or at least, it is in my limited
                                                                                experience.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I found myself in a baby�s body,
                                                                                half-blind, barely able to move, my
                                                                                lungs ripping out in a scream, my skin
                                                                                raw and cold. My last memory was a
                                                                                gunshot. No dignified truck-kun exit for
                                                                                me. Just walking through a mall and
                                                                                suddenly I was exiting a womb, an
                                                                                experience I do not recommend
                                                                                remembering.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                It took time for me to rebuild my mind.
                                                                                Months. I had the mind of a grown man,
                                                                                pushing through the synapses of a
                                                                                newborn. My first moments were trying to
                                                                                move. Then I had to get over the
                                                                                undignified act of breastfeeding from a
                                                                                woman I didn�t know, which couldn�t have
                                                                                been weird.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Mom and Dad. They were nothing like my
                                                                                last set. Arabian still, but from Egypt
                                                                                rather than Morocco. And they were
                                                                                British. Which made sense. Because
                                                                                everyone around me was.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                It was a travesty. A red-blooded
                                                                                American, born in London and living in
                                                                                Surrey. Newborns, as it turns out, have
                                                                                the brain capacity for annoyance. Or at
                                                                                least, I did.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Months, a full couple of years really,
                                                                                of rebuilding myself, mind and body. You
                                                                                never think about how hard the simple
                                                                                act of movement is for babies. Getting
                                                                                from lying on my back to crawling around
                                                                                took four months. And it was boring.
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Also, apparently my name was Gareth
                                                                                Ahmed this time. Gareth. Wow. What a
                                                                                name.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                My mom and dad were sweethearts, always
                                                                                keeping an eye on me, teaching me what
                                                                                they could. I tried my best to work with
                                                                                them, laughing the way a baby should at
                                                                                certain things. I did throw in some
                                                                                annoying bits. It sucked, waking them up
                                                                                at night. But I didn�t know what else I
                                                                                could do?<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I wasn�t exactly Anos Voldigoad, born
                                                                                talking like a grown ass man. I had to
                                                                                exercise my throat, stretch out my
                                                                                vocals and practice them. So I couldn�t
                                                                                explain, �hey, mom and dad, this ain�t
                                                                                my first go around on the Earth and I
                                                                                really don�t consider you my mom and
                                                                                dad.�<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I felt like an asshole for feeling that
                                                                                way. But they were more akin to a pair
                                                                                of very nice people I liked. I couldn�t
                                                                                mentally just replace them with my own
                                                                                parents. I didn�t even try. It was just
                                                                                so weird and it made me feel guilty as
                                                                                sin.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Why had it happened? Why did I just get
                                                                                brain shuffled into this body? What was
                                                                                the reason? I should have been in the
                                                                                afterlife, or just gone in a black void.
                                                                                Getting all the great answers.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Instead I was trying to convince my body
                                                                                that solid food was good. I was so
                                                                                goddamn tired of baby food�<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I enjoyed having brand new eyes and an
                                                                                unscarred body of course. Everything was
                                                                                so clear, and I had none of the aches
                                                                                and pains that grow in you as you become
                                                                                an adult. <br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Years passed. Plus side of being an
                                                                                adult in a child's body, you can funnel
                                                                                your eternal energy into full on
                                                                                projects. I slept, ate, and worked out.
                                                                                Well, close to it as I could. At first
                                                                                it was just me trying to stop feeling
                                                                                like I was useless. But by the time I
                                                                                turned four I was exercising as much as
                                                                                I could. I was speaking around 9 months
                                                                                and graduated to actual sentences by
                                                                                fourteen, though I held back as much as
                                                                                possible. <br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                It was impossible to be entirely normal
                                                                                though. My parents noticed that I wasn�t
                                                                                a normal newborn quick. I was too
                                                                                focused. I was too quick on the uptake,
                                                                                and I didn�t freak out the way little
                                                                                kids often did. <br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                When I was four, they sent me to a
                                                                                therapist. Or as they said, �a very nice
                                                                                man who wants to talk to you!�<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Like I said. Sweethearts. My mom was
                                                                                pregnant at the time. In my last life,
                                                                                I�d had five siblings by the time I was
                                                                                a teen. I wondered if that was going to
                                                                                be replicated here.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I spoke to the therapist for around an
                                                                                hour. When we left, he officially called
                                                                                me a sociopath. I called him a quack and
                                                                                told my parents I wasn�t going to deal
                                                                                with someone like that again if I could
                                                                                help it.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Still, after that they seemed to treat
                                                                                me differently. I didn�t mind it. I was
                                                                                a better kid to them than I had been to
                                                                                my real parents, I�m sad to say. Cleaned
                                                                                up after myself, ate my food, and
                                                                                eventually watched out for my baby
                                                                                brother, Ali. Funny, I had a cousin with
                                                                                the same name in my last life.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Still, you can�t live as an adult in a
                                                                                child�s body without other kids noticing
                                                                                how weird you are. The kid who spends
                                                                                time reading, working out, and acts like
                                                                                an old man rather than getting pulled
                                                                                into classroom politics gets
                                                                                noticed.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                And don�t tell me it isn�t politics.
                                                                                Kids may be rudimentary at it, but
                                                                                they�re as cutthroat as any real life
                                                                                Senator. Or a House of Lord guy?
                                                                                Whatever the British version was, I
                                                                                didn�t care.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Anyways, after my new body turned 6 and
                                                                                I was in my second year of school was
                                                                                when I got into my first fight in
                                                                                school. Some kid pushing his weight
                                                                                around. I tossed him on his back and
                                                                                held him down until the teacher
                                                                                separated us. Nothing serious. I wasn�t
                                                                                about to really fight a kid.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                He came back with some more subtle
                                                                                bullying. Or subtle in his mind. Racism
                                                                                mostly. I let it go up until he insulted
                                                                                my fake mom.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I held him an arm bar after school and
                                                                                walked him through why it was wrong to
                                                                                treat others the way he had. <br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Kid backed off, and I gained a
                                                                                reputation for being a delinquent. Never
                                                                                mind the facts, I�d threatened to break
                                                                                someone's arm for being disrespectful.
                                                                                Ha! Kids are cute.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Of course, my somewhat peaceful life
                                                                                ended at 9 years old when I eventually
                                                                                got transferred to a new school. St.
                                                                                Grogory's Primary School. If you
                                                                                recognize the name, good on you, because
                                                                                I didn�t.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I was reborn in 1980. The only reason
                                                                                that matter to me was that I was making
                                                                                plans to invest in various companies
                                                                                down the road. I didn�t consider that an
                                                                                important year.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                So when I entered St. Grogory's and
                                                                                stood in a classroom as my teacher
                                                                                introduced me to my class, that was the
                                                                                first time the pieces came together.
                                                                                Because of a single kid in the back of
                                                                                the class.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                He was skinny as hell, painfully so, and
                                                                                practically swimming in clothing too big
                                                                                for him. His glasses were large and
                                                                                round, on top of a pair of extremely
                                                                                green eyes. And under his bowl cut hair,
                                                                                I could barely see a lightning bolt
                                                                                shaped scar.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I kept control of my face despite the

                                                                                dad, rather than acknowledging Harry's
                                                                                comment. &quot;Harry is as much of a

                                                                                <br />

                                                                                You are a trouble <i>generator.</i>
                                                                                Reactor even.&quot;<br />

                                                                                a moment I missed my real dad even more.
                                                                                He'd have liked my new one.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Drive safe, dad.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                He nodded, then reached out and gave
                                                                                Harry a hug. The bespectacled kid looked

                                                                                when I turned back Harry looked

                                                                                <br />

                                                                                Three-Quarters?&quot; Harry asked me.

                                                                                anyone?&quot;<br />

                                                                                &quot;It's London,&quot; Harry pointed

                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Oh right. Lots of guys and gals in hats.
                                                                                Some of them weirder than those on the
                                                                                wizards, what with 80's and 90's culture
                                                                                running wild. Well, that was fine. I was
                                                                                looking for hair in reality. Of a
                                                                                specific shade.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                A flash of red. Then another, and
                                                                                another, and another. I grinned.<br />

                                                                                &quot;Where?&quot; Harry looked around.

                                                                                they're wizards?&quot;<br />

                                                                                &quot;-- packed with Muggles, of course
                                                                                --&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Harry gave me a look of shock. I
                                                                                shrugged. &quot;Honestly, it was the owl
                                                                                and trunks.&quot;<br />

                                                                                He accepted that and chased after the
                                                                                group with me. As we did, I took note of

                                                                                nervously.<br />

                                                                                bushy haired and bright eyed, looked
                                                                                around at us, her eyes brightening.
                                                                                &quot;Oh, Neville! Did you find your
                                                                                toad?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Not yet,&quot; Neville said
                                                                                miserably. &quot;But they're trying to
                                                                                help me with a spell.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;You're-&quot; then she saw my face
                                                                                and gasped. &quot;You're the boy from
                                                                                the platform!&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;I am?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;The one who said bad
                                                                                words!&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;I am.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                She looked positively scandalized.
                                                                                Adorable. Positively adorable. Quick,
                                                                                distract her!<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;I'm trying to remember a spell I
                                                                                read to help find Neville's toad. But I
                                                                                don't remember the wand
                                                                                movement.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Her righteous anger was driven away by
                                                                                scientific curiosity. &quot;Oh? What's
                                                                                the spell?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Accio,&quot; I invited her to sit
                                                                                with a wave of my hand (being careful to
                                                                                keep the hand holding my wand still. She
                                                                                plopped down across from me, next to
                                                                                Harry. Just like that, Harry had
                                                                                Hermione on one side and Ron on the
                                                                                other.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                The universe had balance.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;The summoning charm? That's pretty
                                                                                advanced. We aren't supposed to learn
                                                                                that until our fourth year,&quot;
                                                                                Hermione said.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Hey, fortune favors the bold,
                                                                                right?&quot; I stared at my wand.
                                                                                &quot;Problem is, I haven't done any
                                                                                magic yet.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;You haven't practiced?&quot; she
                                                                                flounced her hair a bit, looking
                                                                                positively smug. &quot;I've tried a few
                                                                                simple spells just for practice and it's
                                                                                all worked for me.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;...Aren't we not allowed to do
                                                                                spells outside of school?&quot; Harry
                                                                                asked.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Her smugness evaporated. &quot;We're
                                                                                not!?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;I thought we weren't?&quot; I
                                                                                said, just as lost.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Hermione's face paled. &quot;I broke a
                                                                                <i>rule</i>!?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                We might as well have suggested she'd
                                                                                committed cannibalism.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;We can't use spells outside school
                                                                                <i>after</i> we enter Hogwarts,&quot;
                                                                                Ron explained. &quot;When we turn 17, we
                                                                                can use them out of school
                                                                                again.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Well I was misinformed as hell
                                                                                then,&quot; I grumbled, rubbing my eyes.
                                                                                Hermione in the meantime looked like her
                                                                                life had stopped flashing before her
                                                                                eyes. &quot;All right. Then I'm gonna
                                                                                give this a try.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I'd practiced the motion a few times.
                                                                                Sort of a half circle. &quot;Ah.
                                                                                Neville. Describe your toad? His
                                                                                name?<br />
                                                                                &quot;Uh, Trevor. He's brown. Has warts?
                                                                                Black eyes.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Mate, it's a toad,&quot; Ron told
                                                                                me, looking at me like I was
                                                                                crazy.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Well, the name helped.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I gave the wand a twirl. I felt a pull
                                                                                of energy. A flash of memory from the
                                                                                book filled my mind.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                <i>It would not work on living things,
                                                                                    although they might be moved
                                                                                    indirectly by summoning things they
                                                                                    were wearing or holding.</i><br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I pushed the thought aside, focusing on
                                                                                the goal. &quot;<i>Accio</i>
                                                                                Trevor!&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                My wand flashed. And another thought
                                                                                came. &quot;Shit!&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Language!&quot; Hermione
                                                                                said.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I ignored her to snap to my feet and
                                                                                open the door.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Thank god. A toad, looking absolutely
                                                                                horrified at his situation, came flying
                                                                                down the hall. I held my shirt out to
                                                                                let him land his dry body in the
                                                                                cotton-polyester blend, and the two of
                                                                                us shared a look of shock.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Trevor!&quot; Neville came over,
                                                                                looking� huh. I wanted to say relief,
                                                                                but he also looked disappointed? What?
                                                                                &quot;Thank you, Gar.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I handed the dry-skinned toad over to
                                                                                him, pet and owner looking slightly put
                                                                                out at what had happened. &quot;No
                                                                                problem. You all want to sit with
                                                                                us?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Ah, can't. All my stuff is in my
                                                                                carriage. Which is� um,&quot; he looked
                                                                                one way, then the other.
                                                                                &quot;Um�&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Neville. Have you forgotten where
                                                                                your carriage is.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                It was not a question.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;I'll help him,&quot; Hermione
                                                                                stood up, walking over to join
                                                                                Neville.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;It was a pleasure meeting you
                                                                                both,&quot; I told them honestly.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Hermione gave me a look. &quot;Hmph!
                                                                                Let's go Neville.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                The Girl Who Scoffed marched off with
                                                                                the Boy Who Forgets, leaving me with-I'm
                                                                                gonna need to stop this joke soon.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Leaving me with Ron and Harry. I entered
                                                                                the carriage with a small smile. Ron
                                                                                shook his head. &quot;That girl is
                                                                                really stuffy, ain't she?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                The irony. &quot;I like her. She's got
                                                                                personality.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;If that's personality, I want
                                                                                nothing to do with it,&quot; Ron took a
                                                                                bite out of another frog. &quot;I hope
                                                                                she's not in my house.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Every Weasley has been in
                                                                                Gryffindor, right?&quot; I teased
                                                                                him.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                He blushed red as his hair. &quot;Yeah.
                                                                                But um, I don't know if I will be. If
                                                                                I'm Ravenclaw my parents won't mind, but
                                                                                if I'm in Slytherin?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                He shuddered.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Honestly on the surface, Slytherin
                                                                                doesn't sound so bad,&quot; I shrugged
                                                                                at the horrified look on Ron's face.
                                                                                &quot;Ambition and drive can be good
                                                                                things. Like all emotions, they have a
                                                                                place. But you know, then a lot of
                                                                                Slytherin's turn out to be
                                                                                assholes.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Ha!&quot; Ron's horror turned to
                                                                                humor. &quot;Assholes! �What are
                                                                                those?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;The hole between your
                                                                                cheeks,&quot; when he pointed at his
                                                                                mouth, I shook my head.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Ron looked like it was christmas
                                                                                morning.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Anyways, I'm okay with any house
                                                                                that won't kill me. How about you,
                                                                                Harry?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Gryffindor or Ravenclaw?&quot;
                                                                                Harry said, rubbing his chin.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                We chatted for a while after that,
                                                                                discussing smaller things.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                It wasn't until a bit later that I
                                                                                realized Draco hadn't shown up.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                <hr class="bbc-hr bbc-hr--3" />
                                                                                <i>Author's Note: </i>Tomorrow, sorting,
                                                                                the ending of this is on my <a
                                                                                    href="https://www.patreon.com/desertchocolate"
                                                                                    target="_blank"
                                                                                    class="link link--external"
                                                                                    rel="nofollow ugc noopener">patreon</a>
                                                                                along with another big chunk of writing.
                                                                            </div>

                                                                    <div class="message-userContent lbContainer js-lbContainer "
                                                                        data-lb-id="post-88866774"
                                                                        data-lb-caption-desc="DesertChocolate &middot; Dec 8, 2022 at 5:28 AM">



                                                                        <article class="message-body js-selectToQuote">














                                                                            <div class="bbWrapper">&quot;Quidditch
                                                                                doesn't make sense.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;It's the perfect game!&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Ron, the game ends with one player
                                                                                basically getting an impossible number
                                                                                of points. A whole team could have
                                                                                worked their asses off to get 140
                                                                                points, only for one guy to catch the
                                                                                snitch and destroy them.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;It's exciting!&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Yeah, it is, except for the snitch
                                                                                thing.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                While Ron looked aghast at me not
                                                                                falling in love with his favorite sport,
                                                                                Harry was more interested. I heard some
                                                                                footsteps come to the door, and when we
                                                                                looked up, the door slid open.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I expected Draco. We got Hermione.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                She scowled briefly at me (like a tiny
                                                                                school teacher, it was adorable), and
                                                                                looked at Ron and Harry. &quot;You all
                                                                                better get ready, I've been up to ask
                                                                                the conductor, and he says we're almost
                                                                                there.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;You saw the cab? What was it
                                                                                like?&quot; I forgot about this
                                                                                happening! &quot;I've been trying to
                                                                                figure out the best way to mix muggle
                                                                                technical principles with wizard magic.
                                                                                How much of what the conductor was doing
                                                                                was pure spellwork?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Oh, it was quite
                                                                                fascinating!&quot; Hermione seemed to
                                                                                snap out of her disdain for me, instead
                                                                                leaning into curiosity. &quot;While much
                                                                                of the controls moved themselves, I
                                                                                noticed he would use his wand
                                                                                periodically to manipulate the steam
                                                                                engine.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Steam engine? I saw it up front,
                                                                                but I guess I expected it to have more
                                                                                electronic parts to it.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;It does! He has a radio, some of
                                                                                the dials look more advanced, and yet
                                                                                the overall structure is from older
                                                                                trains.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Are they really getting excited
                                                                                about trains?&quot; Ron asked Harry, who
                                                                                only shrugged.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;See, I've been trying to think of
                                                                                a variety of muggle inventions that
                                                                                might be improved by magic, but based on
                                                                                what I've seen, more complex devices
                                                                                don't respond well to it. They say they
                                                                                don't work in places like Hogwarts or
                                                                                the Ministry. That makes me wonder if
                                                                                maybe magic and electricity don't
                                                                                interact well, and if maybe a Faraday
                                                                                Cage could help with that..&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Hermione nodded, rubbing her chin
                                                                                thoughtfully. &quot;I could see that,
                                                                                but you need more to prove your
                                                                                hypothesis.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;I have one thing. There seems to
                                                                                be a lack of magical spells dedicated to
                                                                                releasing pure electricity. Fire,
                                                                                sparks, other forms of plasma, but not
                                                                                actual electricity. But of course, that
                                                                                could be just my lack of knowledge.
                                                                                Can't claim to know everything, just
                                                                                learn what I can. I did bring some small
                                                                                electronic devices to test
                                                                                with.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Of varying levels of
                                                                                complexity?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Of course. If the line can be
                                                                                figured out, or even if a way for the
                                                                                most advanced of magical tech to adjust
                                                                                to magic� and possibly? To power them
                                                                                with magic. Though that's a pipe dream
                                                                                for now.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Yes, I was going to say you might
                                                                                wish to make your wishes more
                                                                                realistic,&quot; she chided.
                                                                                &quot;Starting small and�
                                                                                ohhhhhhh!&quot; she suddenly pointed her
                                                                                finger at me. &quot;You!&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Uh� me?&quot; I blinked, surprised
                                                                                at the turn in conversation.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;You distracted me! Oh, I'm not
                                                                                going to have time to put on my robes!
                                                                                You, you, you boy!&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                She spun and rushed off in a tizzy. I'd
                                                                                never seen a tizzy before, but that had
                                                                                to be it.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                I turned to look at Ron and Harry, both
                                                                                dressed in their robes. Ron shook his
                                                                                head, while Harry was silently shaking
                                                                                his shoulders. He was laughing. My
                                                                                bespectacled devious friend was laughing
                                                                                at me.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Mate, I think she's crazy.&quot;
                                                                                Ron said.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;Of course she is. She's a
                                                                                scientist at heart.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                He sighed. &quot;Yeah, leave it to a
                                                                                nutter to not understand
                                                                                Quidditch.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;In my defense, I wasn't much for
                                                                                Soccer either.&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;What the bloody hell is
                                                                                soccer?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;He means football,&quot; Harry
                                                                                said helpfully.<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                &quot;What the bloody hell is
                                                                                football!?&quot;<br />
                                                                                <br />
                                                                                Ron followed us, clearly picturing a
                                                                                sport where severed human feet were used
                                                                                as sporting equipment. He just had that
                                                                                face, you know?<br />
